question:
With the aid of diagrams, describe the characteristic and mode of formation of any two of the following:

(a) Rock pedestal (b) Yardang (c) Mesa
answer:
(a) ROCK PEDESTALS:
Characteristics:

  • It has soft and hard rock layers, mushroom with irregular shape formed in desert e.g Sahara desert
  • The soft rock layers is eroded more rapidly resulting in the formation of irregular edge of alternate bands of hard and soft rock.
  • Further erosion at the base produces a mushroom-shaped feature .

(ii) YANDANG: This is an erosional  feature formed by wind abrasion in  desert e.g Atacama desert. It has vertical bands or hard and soft rocks  of height between 5-15cm.
Characteristics:

  • Yandang is found in the desert.
  • Vertical bands of hard and soft rocks standing in the direction of prevailing wind is eroded such that Rock the softer rock is eroded faster than the hard rock resulting in the formation of Yandang.

question:
(a) Draw an annotated diagram to show the relief of the ocean basin

(b) Describe the characteristics of any two of the relief features shown on your diagram
answer:
(a)

 Features to be identified include:

(i) Continental shelf

(ii) Continental slope

(iii) Ocean deep

(iv) Continental edge Land

 (v) Minor trench

(vi) Ocean ridge

(b)(i) Continental shelf:   It has shallow, gentle slope with gradient of 1/500 and it is a continuation of the land to the sea. It occupies about 7% of the total area of the oceans. It is the richest fishing ground, allows ships to move inland and also allows  recreational facilities e.g New found land

(ii) Continental slope: It is steep of depth up to 1801 5401 metres. It joins the continental shelf with the deep sea plain. It is located near the continent.

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Nigeria, show and name the
(i) three climatic belts;
(ii) dominant air masses which influence the climate of Nigeria

(b) Outline three ways in which the Sudan savannah vegetation has adapted itself to the climate in Nigeria

(c) In what four ways is natural vegetation of economic importance to man in Nigeria?
answer:
(a)(i) Map of Nigeria showing three climatic belts


(ii) The dominant air mass

(a) Tropical Maritime air mass and

(b) Tropical continental air mass

 Three adaptation of Sudan savanna to climate of Nigeria

(i) Trees have long tap roots which reach ground water during dry season.

(ii) Shedding of leaves in the dry season

(iii) Thorny leaves to control rate of evapo-transpiration

(c) Four economic importance of vegetation to man include:

(i) Provision of food e.g fruits, seeds etc for man

(ii) Provision of food for animals

(iii) Provision of raw materials for industrial purposes e.g twines, ropes

(iv) Provision of employment and fuel.

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria, locate and name:

(i) the rail lines linking Lagos to Nguru

(ii) the railway line linking Port-Harcourt to Kaduna

(b) Explain any four ways in which rail contributed to the economic development of Nigeria

(c) Highlight any three problems of rail transportation in Nigeria
answer:
(b) Four contributions of railway to the economic development of Nigeria include:

(i) Transportation of manufactured goods

(ii) Evacuation of agricultural goods

(iii) Generation of income to government

(iv) Provision of employment to people.

(c) Three problems of rail transportation in Nigeria include:

(i) Slow speed of rail

(ii) Inadequate capital

(iii) Poor management of rail transport

question:

(i) two areas important for fruit farming
(ii) two areas important for irrigation agriculture
(iii) one important town in each area

(b) What three problems face the cultivation of fruits in the area selected in (b) above?
answer:
(b) Three problems facing the cultivation of fruits in the area.

(i) Hilly topography limits extension of farms

(ii) soil erosion resulting from steep hills

(iii) Inadequate storage facilities
